Cerita Lem Aibon dan Panggung Atraksi Si Orang Baru
01 Nov 2019, 05:46 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Kehebohan soal anggaran lem Aibon Rp 82 miliar di rencana anggaran DKI Jakarta 2020 masih berlanjut. Sindiran pun dilempar Gubernur DKI, Anies Baswedan, ke 'orang baru' yang muncul menyoroti anggaran-anggaran ini.
Istilah 'orang baru' ini dilontarkan Anies ketika menjawab pertanyaan awak media saat ia ditanya mengenai anggaran lem aibon yang ditulis oleh Suku Dinas Pendidikan Wilayah 1 Jakarta Barat di website resmi Pemprov DKI Jakarta. Istilah itu dipakai Anies saat ditanya soal PSI yang getol menyoroti anggaran-anggaran ini.
Cerita ini berawal ketika anggaran lem aibon disorot oleh anggota DPRD DKI Jakarta Fraksi PSI William Aditya Sarana di akun media sosialnya. William kala itu mem-posting screen capture apbd.jakarta.go.id yang menunjukan anggaran lem aibon senilai Rp 82,8 miliar untuk kegiatan Biaya Operasional Pendidikan Sekolah Dasar Negeri. Tak hanya itu, William juga menyoroti anggaran pulpen Rp 124 miliar hingga komputer. Pada keesokan harinya, PSI juga menggelar konferensi pers soal anggaran DKI Jakarta.
Kemudian Anies menjelaskan satu per satu mengapa angka itu bisa muncul di website APBD DKI. Menurut Anies, itu terjadi karena ada kesalahan sistem. Ia merasa sistem anggaran DKI Jakarta saat ini sudah digital, tapi tidak smart atau pintar. Akibatnya, masih ada masalah dalam penganggaran selama bertahun-tahun.
"Iya, jadi sistemnya sekarang ini sudah digital, but not a smart system. Itu hanya digital aja, mengandalkan orang untuk me-review. Itu sudah berjalan bertahun tahun. Karena itu, ini akan diubah, tidak akan dibiarkan begitu saja. Let's do it in a smart way," jelas Anies.
Ia pun mengaku sudah mengecek satu per satu anggaran itu sebelum disorot William dan PSI. Ia mengatakan sudah menemukan keanehan pada anggaran itu sejak awal dan akan melakukan perbaikan.
"Sebelum mereka (PSI) ngomong, saya sudah ngomong. Saya sudah bicara di dalam. Saya sudah bicara sebelumnya dan kita review," kata Anies.

The Aibon Glue Story and the Stage of the New Person's Attraction
Nov 01 2019, 05:46 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - The excitement over the Aibon glue budget of Rp. 82 billion in the DKI Jakarta 2020 budget plan continues. Satire was also thrown by the Governor of DKI, Anies Baswedan, to the 'new people' who appeared to highlight these budgets.
The term 'new person' was uttered by Anies when answering the media crew's question when he was asked about the budget of the aibon glue written by the West Jakarta Region 1 District Education Office on the official website of the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government. The term was used by Anies when asked about the PSI who was keen to highlight these budgets.
This story begins when the budget of the aibon glue is highlighted by members of the DKI Jakarta DPRD Faction PSI William Aditya Sarana in his social media account. William at that time posted a screen capture of apbd.jakarta.go.id, which showed a budget of Rp.87.8 billion for aibon glue for the Operational Costs of State Elementary School Education. Not only that, William also highlighted the pen budget of Rp 124 billion to computers. The next day, PSI also held a press conference regarding the DKI Jakarta budget.
Then Anies explained one by one why that number could appear on the DKI APBD website. According to Anies, that happened because there was a system error. He feels that the current DKI Jakarta budget system is already digital, but it is not smart or smart. As a result, there are still problems in budgeting for years.
"Yes, so the system is now digital, but not a smart system. It's just digital, relying on people to review. It has been running for years. Therefore, this will be changed, it will not be left alone. Let's do it in a smart way, "explained Anies.
He also claimed to have checked the budget one by one before being highlighted by William and PSI. He said that he had found oddities in the budget from the beginning and would make improvements.
"Before they (PSI) talked, I already said. I had talked inside. I had talked before and we reviewed it," Anies said.
